result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas H Conti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas H Conti is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas H Conti was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Nicholas H Conti was found guilty of Possession of THC. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: FTP Warrant mailed to Defendant has been returned via USPS.  Return to Sender.  Moved.  Left No Address.  Unable to Forward.
Notice of Certification - Tax Intercept mailed to Defendant has been returned via USPS.  Return to Sender.  Moved.  Left No Address.  Unable to Forward.
sent to GLSO October 24, 2016
from Clerk to Defendant
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan Agreement.
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
FTP Hearing 10-19-2015 for $1752.00
Settlement Form (PTC)

10:20 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Henry Conti.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites the plea agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and count 3 amended to county ordinance possess THC.  State concurs.  Atty Conti concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 3 as amended to county ordinance.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed outright & count 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  State moves to amend count 3 to county ordinace posess THC.  Defendant enters a plea of No Contest.  Court finds the defendant guilty and imposes a $100 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by Atty Conti.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

Count 1 (OWI-2nd):

5 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days
$350 fine plus costs
$42.50 blood draw fee
OWI assess
D.L. revocation - 12 months
Ignition Interlock Device - 12 months

Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 10:29 a.m.

Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.
